item.title: ENG BLEED Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valves (PRSOV) (L & R)

remarks.para: Except for ER operations beyond 120 minutes, one may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated engine BLEED switch remains OFF,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
Remaining (opposite) engine bleed system and its associated pack are operative, and
Aircraft remains at or below FL350.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Aircraft remains at or below FL350.

placard.para: Placard applicable BLEED AIR L or R ENG switchlight located on Bleed Air Supply Module (M10259) on P5 panel "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Notify Flight Dispatch. Aircraft operation, procedures and flight planning may be affected.
Press BLEED AIR L and R ENG switchlight on pilots overhead P5 panel to OFF. Verify OFF lights come on.
If OFF light does not come on:
Open applicable engine right core cowl (418R Left engine, 428AR Right engine).

Rotate manual override hex nut on pressure regulating and shutoff valve clockwise until the poppet valve lever falls into the lock arm assembly notch. The word "LOCKED" should be visible on the valve body beneath the cam. Ensure the poppet valve lever is not in the detent position.
Open applicable strut pressure relief door (433LR Right engine, 433LL Left engine).

Rotate the manual override hex nut on the pressure regulating and shutoff valve clockwise until the poppet valve lever falls into the lock arm assembly notch. The word "LOCKED" should be visible on the valve body beneath the cam. Ensure the poppet valve lever is not in the detent position.
